arm_group.description: Prospective, randomized controlled clinical unicentric study, in ICU, Cannulation of  the subclavian venous  and examination guided with ultrasound

arm_group.arm_group_label: landmark method and examination with chest radiography
arm_group.description: Prospective, randomized controlled clinical unicentric study, in ICU, Cannulation of  the subclavian venous  and examination guided with ultrasound

brief_summary.textblock:
Prospective, randomized controlled clinical unicentric study, in ICU, Cannulation of  the
      subclavian venous  and examination guided with ultrasound

clinical_study.brief_title: SUBclavian Central Venous Catheters Guidance and Examination by UltraSound
condition: Patient Covered by French Health Care System

detailed_description.textblock:
One groupe : Ultrasound guided for cannulation and examination of absence ofcomplications
      One groupe : landmark method and examination with chest radiography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  adults patients

          -  requiring  subclavian vein cannulation

          -  patient covered by french health care system

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patient refusal

          -  requiring vein cannulation femoral or jugular

          -  we see nothing with echocardiography

          -  children and not adult patients

arm_group_label: ultrasound guided for cannulation and examination
landmark method and examination with chest radiography

clinical_study.official_title: SUBclavian Central Venous Catheters Guidance and Examination by UltraSound : a Randomized Controlled Study Versus Landmark Method

primary_outcome.measure: procedure time between the beginning of  procedure ( TO) and when the catheter is controlled ( T4)  between strategy catheter cannulation  'standard' and a strategy called "ultrasound all

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: procedure time Tn-Tn (n 0-5) between the two strategies.
incidence of occurrence of complications: pneumothorax, hemothorax, bad positioning (outside of the superior vena cava or the right atrium) between the two strategies
failure of technology between the two strategies.
occurrence of central venous catheter infection.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
